Set.Text: [ICON_Bullet][ICON_Religion] Religious Unit.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Spreads [ICON_Religion] Religious Pressure to convert [ICON_Citizen] Citizens within a City.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Cannot initiate [ICON_Religion] Theological Combat.

[ICON_Bullet][ICON_Religion] Religious Unit.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Spreads [ICON_Religion] Religious Pressure to convert [ICON_Citizen] Citizens within a City.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Can initiate [ICON_Religion] Theological Combat.

[ICON_Bullet][ICON_Religion] Religious Unit.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Eliminates at least 75% of [ICON_Religion] Religious Pressure of enemy [ICON_Religion] Religions.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Can initiate [ICON_Religion] Theological Combat.
[ICON_Religion] Religious Unit.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Heals itself and adjacent friendly [ICON_Religion] Religious Units.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Cannot initiate [ICON_Religion] Theological Combat.
[ICON_Bullet]Must be purchased with [ICON_Faith] Faith.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Can build a National Park to attract [ICON_Tourism] Tourists.

[ICON_Bullet]Can perform a [ICON_Tourism] Rock Concert at a valid venue, including at [ICON_DISTRICT_WONDER] Wonders, at a [ICON_DISTRICT_THEATER] District with one of the required buildings, or at a special target allowed by one of the Rock Band's [ICON_Promotion] Promotions.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Their Album Sales stat is the expected [ICON_Tourism] Tourism strength at their next concert.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]After performing concerts their Album Sales and Rock Band Level may increase.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Must be purchased with [ICON_Faith] Faith.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Cannot perform on the same tile twice.

[ICON_Bullet][ICON_Unit] Land Melee class Unit that must be unlocked with the [ICON_Religion] Shaolin School or Sohei School Religious Beliefs.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Can only be purchased with [ICON_Faith] Faith in Cities with a [ICON_Buildings] Temple.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Has a unique [ICON_Promotion] Promotion Tree.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength with the [ICON_Culture] Feudalism, Divine Right, Reformed Church, Nationalism, and Ideology Civics.

[ICON_Bullet][ICON_Unit] Land Melee class Unit that must be unlocked with Suzerainty of Lahore or the [ICON_Religion] Army of the Immortal Religious Belief.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Can only be purchased with [ICON_Faith] Faith.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Begins with 25 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength, increasing by +15 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength after the player builds their first [ICON_Buildings] Barracks, Armory, and Military Academy.
[ICON_Bullet][ICON_GreatGeneral] Great Generals have unique effects pertaining to war, and passively empower [ICON_Unit] Military Units of certain Eras.
[ICON_Bullet][ICON_GreatAdmiral] Great Admirals have unique effects pertaining to war, and passively empower [ICON_Unit] Naval Units of certain Eras.
[ICON_Bullet][ICON_GreatEngineer] Great Engineers have unique effects pertaining to [ICON_Production] Production and Industry when activated.
[ICON_Bullet][ICON_GreatMerchant] Great Merchants have unique effects pertaining to [ICON_Gold] Gold and Economics when activated.
[ICON_Bullet][ICON_GreatProphet] Great Prophets can found a [ICON_Religion] Religion when activated.
[ICON_Bullet][ICON_GreatScientist] Great Scientists have unique effects pertaining to [ICON_Science] Science and Progress when activated.
[ICON_Bullet][ICON_GreatWriter] Great Writers generate a [ICON_GreatWork_Writing] Great Work of Writing when activated.
[ICON_Bullet][ICON_GreatArtist] Great Artists generate a [ICON_GreatWork_Landscape] Great Work of Art when activated.
[ICON_Bullet][ICON_GreatMusician] Great Musicians generate a [ICON_GreatWork_Music] Great Work of Music when activated.

[ICON_Bullet][ICON_GreatGeneral] Comandante Generals are unique to Simón Bolívar, have unique effects pertaining to more than just war, and passively empower [ICON_Unit] Military Units of certain Eras.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet] Nearby [ICON_Unit] Llanero Units benefit from the active effects of a [ICON_GreatGeneral] Commandante General.

[ICON_Bullet]May create a new City.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]A City that produces or purchases a Settler loses 1 [ICON_Citizen] Population.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]The starting [ICON_Unit] Settler(s) gains bonuses to [ICON_Movement] Movement and [ICON_VisTopSecret] Sight.
[ICON_Bullet]May build [ICON_Charges] Improvements, remove Features, or Harvest various Resources.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Builders begin with 3 [ICON_Charges] Charges.
[ICON_Bullet]Maintains a [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route per turn.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Builds roads on tiles that are passed through.

[ICON_Bullet]Must be produced or purchased inside of a City with a Archaeological Museum.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Extract [ICON_GreatWork_Artifact] Artifacts from [ICON_RESOURCE_ANTIQUITY_SITE] Antiquity Sites.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Extracted [ICON_GreatWork_Artifact] Artifacts are placed within the Archaeolgical Museum of the City the Archaeologist came from.

[ICON_Bullet]Performs secret missions in Cities and Districts.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Missions can be performed in foreign or domestic Cities, however malicious missions cannot be used against [ICON_Alliance] Allies.

[ICON_Bullet]Ancient Era [ICON_Unit] Support class Unit.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]When adjacent to a City, attacking [ICON_Unit] Melee and Anti-Cavalry class Units do full damage to the City's Ancient Walls.

[ICON_Bullet]Medieval Era [ICON_Unit] Support class Unit.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]When adjacent to a city, attacking [ICON_Unit] Melee and Anti-Cavalry class Units ignore Ancient and Medieval Walls and immediately assault the city.

[ICON_Bullet]Medieval Era [ICON_Unit] Support Unit.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Requires an Armory to produce.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Can construct [ICON_Charges] Roads, Forts, Airstrips, and Missile Silo Improvements.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Can construct [ICON_Charges] Railroads for 1 [ICON_Resource_Iron] Iron and [ICON_Resource_Coal] Coal.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Can spend a [ICON_Charges] Charge to complete 20% of a [ICON_DISTRICT_AQUEDUCT] Aqueduct, [ICON_DISTRICT_CANAL] Canal, [ICON_DISTRICT_DAM] Dam, or [ICON_Buildings] Flood Barrier.
[ICON_Bullet]Industrial Era [ICON_Unit] Support class Unit.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Increases the healing of stationary and adjacent stationary [ICON_Unit] Units by +20 HP.

[ICON_Bullet]Modern Era [ICON_Unit] Support class Unit.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Increases the healing of stationary and adjacent stationary [ICON_Unit] Units.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+1 [ICON_Movement] Movement for adjacent [ICON_Unit] Units at the start of the turn.
[ICON_Bullet]Modern Era [ICON_Unit]Support class Unit.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Grants +1 [ICON_Range] Range to [ICON_Unit] Siege class Units within 1 tile.
[ICON_Bullet]Atomic Era [ICON_Unit] Support class Unit.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Grants +1 [ICON_Range] Range and +5 [ICON_Bombard] Bombard Strength to [ICON_Unit] Siege class Units within 1 tile.
[ICON_Bullet]Atomic Era [ICON_Unit] Support class Unit.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Provides cover from air attacks up to 1 tile away from the [ICON_Unit] Unit.
[ICON_Bullet]Information Era [ICON_Unit] Support class Unit.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Provides cover from air and nuclear attacks up to 1 tile away from the [ICON_Unit] Unit.

[ICON_Bullet]Sumerian unique Ancient Era [ICON_Unit] Heavy Cavalry class Unit that replaces the Heavy Chariot.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Does not require any [ICON_Science] Technology.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]No penalties against [ICON_Unit] Anti-Cavalry class Units.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+1 [ICON_Movement] Movement if starting the turn on [ICON_Terrain] Open Terrain.

[ICON_Bullet]Victoria's unique Industrial Era [ICON_Unit] Melee class Unit that replaces the Rifleman.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on a [ICON_Terrain] Continent that the [ICON_Capital] Capital is not on.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]No [ICON_Movement] Movement cost to disembark.

[ICON_Bullet]Theodore Roosevelt's unique Industrial Era [ICON_Unit] Heavy class Unit.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_Culture] Culture is earned from kills on their [ICON_Capital] Capital's continent.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on [ICON_Terrain] Hill Terrain.

[ICON_Bullet]Roman unique Classical Era [ICON_Unit] Melee class Unit that replaces the Swordsman.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Can build a [ICON_Charges] Roman Fort.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Can chop down [ICON_Terrain] Features.

[ICON_Bullet]Japanese unique Medieval Era [ICON_Unit] Melee class Unit that replaces the Man-at-Arms.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Does not suffer penalties from being [ICON_Damaged] Damaged.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Gain [ICON_Science] Science, [ICON_Culture] Culture, [ICON_Gold] Gold, and [ICON_Faith] Faith equal to 15% of a killed enemy [ICON_Unit] Unit's [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength.

[ICON_Bullet]Norwegian unique Medieval Era [ICON_Unit] Melee class Unit that replaces the Man-at-Arms.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]-5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending against melee attacks.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Gain +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement when starting the turn in enemy territory.

[ICON_Bullet]Russian unique Industrial Era [ICON_Unit] Light Cavalry class Unit that replaces Cavalry.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting in or adjacent to home territory.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Can move after attacking, if [ICON_Movement] Movement points remain.

[ICON_Bullet]Arabian unique Medieval Era [ICON_Unit] Heavy Cavalry class Unit that replaces the Knight.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Heals at the end of every turn, even after moving or attacking.

[ICON_Bullet]English unique Renaissance Era [ICON_Unit] Naval Raider class Unit that replaces the Privateer.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Has a chance to capture the enemy [ICON_Unit] Naval Units of other Civilizations.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Invisible unless revealed by Cities, Encampments, or [ICON_Unit] other Naval Raiders, Destroyers, and adjacent Units.

[ICON_Bullet]French unique Industrial Era [ICON_Unit] Melee class Unit that replaces the Rifleman.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on your [ICON_Capital] Capital's continent.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Gain bonus [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great General points for killing [ICON_Unit] Units.

[ICON_Bullet]German unique Modern Era [ICON_Unit] Naval Raider class Unit that replaces the Submarine.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+1 [ICON_VisTopSecret] Sight and +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on Ocean tiles.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Invisible unless revealed by Cities, Encampments, or [ICON_Unit] other Naval Raiders, Destroyers, and adjacent Units.

[ICON_Bullet]American unique Atomic Era [ICON_Unit] Fighter class Unit that replaces the Fighter.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against [ICON_Unit] Fighter class Aircraft.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+2 Flight Range.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+50% [ICON_Ability] Experience earned.
[ICON_Bullet]Brazilian unique Industrial Era [ICON_Unit] Naval Ranged class Unit that replaces the Battleship.

[ICON_Bullet]Polish unique Medieval Era [ICON_Unit] Heavy Cavalry class Unit that replaces the Cuirassier.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Pushes defending enemy [ICON_Unit] Units back 1 tile in any battle where they deal more damage; enemy defenders that cannot retreat suffer additional [ICON_Damaged] Damage.

[ICON_Bullet]Australian unique Modern Era [ICON_Unit] Melee class Unit that replaces Infantry.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on [ICON_Terrain] Coastal tiles.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on neutral or foreign territory.

[ICON_Bullet]Macedonian unique Classical Era [ICON_Unit] Heavy Cavalry class Unit that replaces the Horseman.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when on a different [ICON_Terrain] Continent than the [ICON_Capital] Capital.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Gain +5 [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great General points when killing an enemy [ICON_Unit] Unit.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Starts with 1 free [ICON_Promotion] Promotion.

[ICON_Bullet]Mongolian unique Medieval Era [ICON_Unit] Ranged class Unit that replaces the Horse Ranger.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Can [ICON_Formation] Escort [ICON_Unit] Civilian and Support Units at the Unit's [ICON_Movement] Movement speed.

[ICON_Bullet]Georgian unique Medieval Era [ICON_Unit] Melee class Unit that replaces the Man-at-Arms.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting in [ICON_Terrain] Hill Terrain.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]No [ICON_Movement] Movement penalty in [ICON_Terrain] Hill Terrain.

[ICON_Bullet]Mapuche unique Renaissance Era [ICON_Unit] Light Cavalry class Unit.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength bonus if within 4 hexes of friendly territory.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Pillaging costs 1 [ICON_Movement] Movement.

[ICON_Bullet]Canadian unique Modern Era [ICON_Unit] Light Cavalry class Unit that replaces the Military Police.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Can create a National Park.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+2 [ICON_VisTopSecret] Sight.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+17 [ICON_Strength] Strength and +1 [ICON_Ranged] Range when occupying a [ICON_District] District.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+1 [ICON_Ranged] Range when in or adjacent to home territory.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting within 2 tiles of a [ICON_Charges] National Park; doubled from a player owned [ICON_Charges] National Park.

[ICON_Bullet]Māori unique Classical Era [ICON_Unit] Melee class Unit that replaces the Swordsman.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Adjacent enemy [ICON_Unit] Units suffer -5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Can build the unique [ICON_Charges] Pā Improvement.

[ICON_Bullet]Ottoman unique Medieval Era [ICON_Unit] Naval Raider class Unit that replaces the Privateer.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]It costs no [ICON_Movement] Movement to [ICON_Pillaged] Coastal Raid.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Invisible unless revealed by Cities, Encampments, or [ICON_Unit] other Naval Raiders, Destroyers, and adjacent Units.

[ICON_Bullet]Ottoman unique Renaissance Era [ICON_Unit] Melee class Unit that replaces the Musketman[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Starts with 1 free [ICON_Promotion] Promotion.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]To train a [ICON_Unit] Janissary a City must have a [ICON_Citizen] Population of at least 2; founded Cities that train a [ICON_Unit] Janissary it consumes 1 [ICON_Citizen] Population; [ICON_Occupied] conquered Cities that train a [ICON_Unit] Janissary do not consume any [ICON_Citizen] Population.

[ICON_Bullet]Phoenician unique Ancient Era [ICON_Unit] Naval Melee class Unit that replaces the Galley.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+1 [ICON_Movement] Movement.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength while defending.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes are immune to being plundered if they are within 4 tiles of a [ICON_Unit] Bireme.

[ICON_Bullet]Swedish unique Renaissance Era [ICON_Unit] Anti-Cavalry class Unit that replaces the Pike and Shot.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+1 [ICON_Movement] Movement.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+3 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength per unused [ICON_Movement] Movement.

[ICON_Bullet]Gran Colombian unique Industrial Era [ICON_Unit] Light Cavalry class Unit that replaces the Cavalry.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+2 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for every adjacent Llanero.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Heals +100 HP when in range of a [ICON_GreatGeneral] Comandante General that activates its [ICON_Ability] Ability.
[ICON_Bullet]Mayan unique Ancient Era [ICON_Unit] Ranged class Unit that replaces the Archer.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting a [ICON_Damaged] Damaged enemy.

[ICON_Bullet]Basil II's unique Medieval Era [ICON_Unit] Heavy Cavalry class Unit that replaces the Knight.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_Unit]Land Units or Religious Units within 1 tile of the Tagma receive +2 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength or +4 [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength.
[ICON_Bullet]Byzantine unique Classical Era [ICON_Unit] Naval Ranged class Unit that replaces the Quadrireme.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against [ICON_Unit] Units.

[ICON_Bullet]Babylonian Ancient Era [ICON_Unit] Melee class Unit that replaces the Scout.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+17 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against [ICON_Unit] Light and Heavy Cavalry Units.

[ICON_Bullet]Vietnamese Medieval Era [ICON_Unit] Ranged class Unit that replaces the Crossbowman.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+1 [ICON_VisTopSecret] Sight and [ICON_Movement] Movement.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Can move after attacking.

[ICON_Bullet]Portuguese Renaissance Era [ICON_Unit] Naval Melee class Unit that replaces the Caravel.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Starts with 1 free [ICON_Promotion] Promotion.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Has 2 [ICON_Charges] Charges to build the Feitoria in foreign borders.

Row.Text: [ICON_Bullet][ICON_Unit] The Saoshyant is the promised saviour of all mankind.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]The player can purchase the [ICON_Unit] The Saoshyant with the [ICON_Religion] The Saoshyant Enhancer Belief in the [ICON_Capital] Capital; there can only be one purchased.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_Unit] The Saoshyant gains double its base [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if the player's [ICON_Religion] Religion is dominate in their Cities.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Resists [ICON_Nuclear] WMDs and Fallout.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Can choose a random [ICON_Promotion] Promotion.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Does not gain [ICON_Ability] Experience.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Can walk on [ICON_Terrain] Water.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Retreats to the [ICON_Capital] Capital if defeated.

[ICON_Bullet]A [ICON_Unit] Builder Unit that can only be obtained through the [ICON_Policy] Slave Drivers Policy or [ICON_Unit] Units that can capture enemy Military Units.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Can build [ICON_Charges] Farms, Mine, Quarry, Fishing Boats, Pasture, Plantation, Camp, Lumber Mill, and all Roads.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Cannot build unique [ICON_Charges] Improvements.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Thrall Workers begin with 4 [ICON_Charges] Charges.

[ICON_Bullet]A [ICON_Unit] Builder and Military Engineer Unit that can only be obtained through the [ICON_Policy] Prisoners of War Camps Policy.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Can build [ICON_Charges] Farms, Mine, Quarry, Fishing Boats, Pasture, Plantation, Camps, Lumber Mills, all Roads, Oil Well, Offshore Oil Rig, Airstrip, Missile Silo, Mountain Tunnel, Geothermal Plant, Seastead, Solar Farm, Windfarm, Offshore Windfarm, and Railroads.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Cannot build unique [ICON_Charges] Improvements.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Prisoners of War begin with 4 [ICON_Charges] Charges.
